Posts.Content: taj72 wrote: My mom was just diagnosed last week.  We are still in the testing stages and waiting for all of the results.  But we have met with the medical oncologist and we know that her BC has attached rather deeply to the chest wall which makes it an automatic stage 3B at least I think.  We are waiting for PET scan to be scheduled to see if its mets. My mom has been experiencing some dizziness at odd times, so the oncologist is concerned that it may have spread to the brain.  We're getting a brain MRI to check.  Also for the past month my mom has been experiencing pain when she breathes and has difficulty catching her breath.  Today she started spitting up some clear phlegm when she coughs. The doctor sent her to the ER tonight to check if there's a blood clot in her lung?  That is where she's at now with my dad and I am waiting to hear what's happening.  I am very worried.  Does any of this sound familiar?  Has anyone experienced this?  Please let me know what you think.  Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Experiencing breathing troubles, any ideas? taj72 taj72

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2009 09:01PM taj72 wrote: Thank you, Shirlann!  I am feeling very overwhelmed.  My mom is not handling this well and is reacting with lots of anger.  My dad seems a little confused and lost and I am left to try to research and figure out what is happening, what will be happening and what should be happening. She did not have a blood clot, thank goodness.  Inhalation treatments were helpful and she was given an inhaler.  She has been getting a battery of tests today and tomorrow and then we just have to wait on the results.  We are praying that it hasn't metstastasized.  I appreciate your response and I pray for your full recovery as well!
Posts.Title: Experiencing breathing troubles, any ideas? taj72 taj72
